'''''The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game''''' is a card-based game released by [[Fantasy Flight Games]]. The game is set during the seventeen year period between Bilbo's 111th birthday
column2: and Frodo's departure from Bag End. ''The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game'' was first announced on [[3 August]] [[2010]]
column3: <ref>[http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/edge_news.asp?eidn=1528 Fantasy Flight Games News] at [http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/ Fantasyflightgames.com](accessed 4 August 2010)</ref> and was released on [[20 April]] [[2011]].<ref>[http://www.middleearthnews.net/2011/04/fantasy-flight-games-releases-lord-of.html Fantasy Flight Games releases The Lord of the Rings Card Game] at [http://www.middleearthnews.net/ Middle-earth News.net] (accessed 15 May 2011)</ref>

column1: It is a [http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/edge_npm.asp?eidm=14 Living Card Game]
column2: which differs from collectible card games in that each expansion is released in fixed packs with no randomness. There are
column4: no "rare" or "common" cards which creates an even playing pool and a system that is easy to collect and fully playable with only the core set and any number of expansions.

column1: [[file:aragornlcg.png|thumb|left|Sample Player Card]]The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game is nearly unique in that it is one of the few cooperative Living Card Games. The players (1-4) work together to defeat the scenario and complete each quest. While the Core Set comes with pre-constructed decks
column2: players are encouraged to create their own starting with up to three hero characters (who start in play) from the spheres of influence.

column1: The player cards are represented through four "spheres"
column2: which relate to various spheres of influence seen in the source material. The four spheres are:
direct damage)
global effects)
cancellation effects)
encounter deck manipulation)

column1: Decks can be constructed using any combination of spheres
column2: but there must be a "resource match" to play the cards from the various spheres. This is done by using the native sphere of the hero
column3: or by giving the hero a new sphere through "song" cards and other effects. Player decks are then composed of varying numbers and combinations of player card types: Allies
column5: and Events. The minimum deck size is 50 cards with a maximum of 3 copies per card.

column2: the players choose a quest scenario and begin setup according to the quest cards. This is where the encounter deck is constructed and shuffled
column3: representing the difficulties the players will face as they complete their quest.

column1: The game is then played in rounds consisting of seven phases
column2: some containing different steps.

column1: #Resource Phase - players draw one card and each hero gains one resource
#Planning Phase - starting with the first player
column2: each player may play Events

column1: #Quest Phase - players commit characters to the quest
column2: reveal encounter cards

column1: #Travel Phase - if there is no active location
column2: players choose a revealed location and travel there

column1: #Encounter Phase - players engage enemies from the staging area for combat

column2: then attack enemies engaged with them.

column1: #Refresh Phase - players ready all exhausted characters and increase their threat trackers by one

Many cards have different effects that can be triggered throughout a round of play to modify or circumvent these rules. Part of the enjoyment of the game is coming up with new ways of beating the various scenarios. Once the completion are requirements are met on the last quest phase (either quest progress
column2: defeated enemies
column3: or captured cards) then the players win. If all heroes are discarded or player threat level reaches 50
column4: then the game is over and the players have lost.

column3: as well as a new quest tied to the corresponding deluxe expansion. The earlier cycles follow a loose series of events
column6: have been released with a very tight story with printed narratives in each Adventure Pack.

''The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game'' is a cooperative card game that puts 1-2 players (or up to four with two Core Sets!) in control of the most powerful characters and artifacts of Middle-earth. Players will select heroes
column2: gather allies
column4: and coordinate their efforts to face Middle-earth's most dangerous fiends. By cooperating to overcome the obstacles drawn from the encounter deck
column5: you will complete the quest before you and claim victory!

column2: along with countless combinations of settings and enemies

column5: and focus their decks on any combination of four distinct spheres of influence: Leadership
column8: and Tactics. Each sphere offer unique benefits to the party
